alert.note: Alert for Middlesex; Norfolk (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 10:22AM EST until further notice by NWS Boston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by the overnight 2 to 4 inches of rain and snowmelt. * WHERE...Portions of central and eastern Massachusetts, including the following counties, in central Massachusetts, Worcester. In eastern Massachusetts, Middlesex and Norfolk. * WHEN...Until 415 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of smaller rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1019 AM EST, Gauge reports indicated that the Charles River at Medway was in minor flood. Other smaller rivers, streams and creeks may experience flooding from the runoff from the earlier heavy rain. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Framingham, Natick, Franklin, Needham, Milford, Wellesley, Dedham, Walpole, Ashland, Bellingham, Hopkinton, Westwood, Holliston, Wayland, Medway, Medfield, Weston, Norfolk, Wrentham and Millis. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
